intro: Herniaria boissieri, commonly known as the rock crasswort, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent stems and small, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. Herniaria boissieri is adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
